channel.title: Digg Top Stories
channel.description: Digg - What the Internet is talking about right now

item.title: Where In The World Is Matt Lauer's Career?
item.description: The truest truism of morning-TV shows is that they are like families, or aspire to be—it’s a matter of practiced artifice, faked from the first minute to the last. But reality can’t always be kept out of the picture.

item.title: Nintendo's Efforts To Explain The Wii U Just Took A Turn For The Absurd
item.description: Nintendo has apparently ramped up its efforts to explain just what the hell that big, glaring "U" means.

item.title: The Man Behind Sexpigeon
item.description: He was a shy West Coast transplant alone in the big city. But equipped with his iPhone camera and a healthy dose of snark, all of New York's pedestrians suddenly became fair game.

item.title: How I Became A Password Cracker
item.description: At the beginning of a sunny Monday morning earlier this month, I had never cracked a password. By the end of the day, I had cracked 8,000.

item.title: LED-Lit Drones Form 'Star Trek' Logo Over London
item.description: Even if you aren't a fan of the 'Star Trek' reboots, you have to admire this marketing stunt.

item.title: Another Sinkhole Opens In Florida
item.description: Yet another sinkhole has appeared in the town of Seffner, Florida just a few blocks from where a different sinkhole killed Jeff Bush earlier this month.

item.title: Spotify Is Planning A Streaming Video Service
item.description: Spotify, the on-demand music service, is planning a major change.

item.title: Death By 1,000 Paper Cuts
item.description: "Sometimes being a software engineer means death by 1000 cuts because you don't have the power to make it stop,. Even the tiniest little things add up to something big — sometimes it's really death by 1000 paper cuts."

item.title: Uncle Sam Wants You To Hack Computers
item.description: How do you lure young web warriors? You turn it into a game.

item.title: The Myth Of The Superbaby
item.description: Can China really breed a crop of genetically selected geniuses?

item.title: You Will Not Believe The Absurd Feats This Soldier Accomplished To Win The Medal Of Honor
item.description: "Without regard for such superior numbers, he unhesitatingly attacked and killed all of them."

item.title: Don't Panic, But A Vial Full Of Deadly Virus Has Gone Missing
item.description: Officials say a vial containing a virus that can cause hemorrhagic fever has gone missing from a research facility in Galveston, but say there's no reason to believe there's a threat to the public.

item.title: Hollywood Companies Are Generating Stunning Visual Effects, But Not Revenue
item.description: This should be a golden age for visual effects in movies. But the companies that create the computer-generated imagery for those blockbusters are struggling as a rising tide of globalization and runaway production takes a toll on an industry that California pioneered.

item.title: 3 Things You Need To Know About The Weekend's Basketball Action
item.description: Didn't have time to watch or didn't really care? If you're not up to speed on the weekend's news but want to be armed with a few things to talk about if someone brings up basketball today, here goes.

item.title: Is The New Pope Green?
item.description: The newly elected pontiff's earlier ministry in Argentina, as well as statements he has made as pope, suggest Francis considers care for the Earth to be entwined with care for the poor.

item.title: How To Get Rid Of Massive Waitlists For Courses And Turn Professors Into Rock Stars
item.description: There has been rapid growth in the number of online-only college courses that have accredited professors teaching audiences that can number in the tens of thousands. It could be a boon for everyone.

item.title: England's Soviet Trail Of Death
item.description: The Cold War may have ended but poisonings, shootings and the attempted murder of former Soviet residents living in Britain continue.

item.title: Recycle Your Old Water Bottles Into Flaming DIY Rockets
item.description: Those of use who know from experience can safely say there's nothing quite as much fun as a homemade rocket. But part of that fun is not getting your hands blown off.

item.title: On The Trail Of $1 Bills Across The U.S.
item.description: When you hear the words "social network" you probably think of Facebook or Twitter. But years before either of those websites — when most of us weren't using the Internet at all — a smaller, stranger community was emerging around something called WheresGeorge.com, a 15-year-old subculture that's dedicated to the $1 bill.

item.title: How To Ship A Panda
item.description: How does one get a rare panda from China to Canada?

item.title: Hunting For Dead Serial Killers
item.description: By day, she runs the sex-crimes division of the Los Angeles County district attorney’s office. In her spare time, she tracks down the DNA of dead rapists, murderers, and serial killers.

item.title: It’s Like They’re Reading My Mind
item.description: How next-generation apps will market your brainwaves.

item.title: Drivers Claim Uber Is Skimming Tips
item.description: Class-action lawsuits are among the latest headaches for Silicon Valley's tech-taxi darling.

item.title: Who Made Spring Break?
item.description: How Easter turned into sun, sand and beer.

item.title: Will Portman: I'm Coming Out
item.description: "I came to Yale as a freshman in the fall of 2010 with two big uncertainties hanging over my head: whether my dad would get elected to the Senate in November, and whether I’d ever work up the courage to come out of the closet."

item.title: Why All Reporters Should Learn To Fly Drones
item.description: The pilotless drone represents an exciting new innovation in the journalist's toolbox.

item.title: The Doctor Will See You Now. All Of You
item.description: A growing number of doctors have begun holding group appointments, seeing up to a dozen patients with similar medical concerns all at once.

item.title: Overweight Man In Park Is Shockingly Good At Juggling A Soccer Ball
item.description: He had excellent control of the ball with his head much like Maradona. The great touch on his heel is similar to the likes of Ronaldinho.
